description: From actor +â€Ž -ess. Probably formed independently of Middle French actrice.

entries.meaning: A female who performs on the stage or in films. [from 17th c.]
examples: Court documents appear to show that Ian Edmondson, a senior News of the World journalist, had authorised Mr Mulcaire to hack phones belonging to Sienna Miller, an actress.

entries.meaning: (now rare) A female doer or "actor" (in a general sense). [from 16th c.]
examples: My mental anguish, and the dreadful scenes in which I had been an actress, advanced the period of my labour.
